text.p: Touchstone Applied Science Associates Inc said Tuesday that it was pleased with its newly acquired "revenue streams" and expects to have "significant" bottom line profits for the foreseeable future.

Andrew Simon, president and chief executive officer, issued the statement as the company reported that for the third quarter ended July 31, its revenues rose 261 percent to $1.5 million from $563,829 in the same period in 1996.
The company attributed the higher revenues to sales generated by BETA Inc and Modern Learning Press, which it acquired earlier this year, and additional sales of the company's core products.

For the latest quarter, however, the company reported an after-tax loss $1.66 million or $0.20 a share, due to both the partial writeoff of purchased goodwill and a reserve established for a loan loss made to the Harriman Group in 1992.
For the 1996 quarter, it had a similar $0.20 a share loss on a net income loss of $673,000.
Touchstone designs, develops, publishes and distributes educational tests, instructional materials, and microcomputer software to elementary and secondary schools, colleges and universities.
